cities.name: Bangkok
cities.theme: Chaos and charm: mega-malls, street food, temples, and tuk-tuks. Plan for heat and traffic.

emergency.pharmacy24h: Boots, Watsons, and hospital pharmacies; 7-Eleven has basics
emergency.health_note: Bumrungrad International is the top-rated hospital for English speakers.

survival.tipping: Not expected, but rounding up 20-50 THB is appreciated in taxis/cafes
survival.digitalEntry: Visa exemption or visa on arrival for many nationals; check evisa.go.th for 2026.
survival.touristTax: No national tourist tax as of 2026.
currentScams: The 'Grand Palace is closed today' lie by tuk-tuk drivers
Unmetered taxis outside major malls (insist on 'Meter, please')
Bird seed/bracelet 'gifts' that you are then forced to pay for

fuel.intel: The 'Pink Uniform' chicken rice is a Michelin-rated survival staple for ~$2-3. Open until 9:30 PM.
fuel.price_anchor: 50-120 THB for a full street meal.

facility_intel.access: Free in malls/BTS; 5-10 THB in markets/parks.
facility_intel.hygiene: Malls are 5-star; public/temple sites are basic.
facility_intel.protocol: Bidet-hose (bum gun) standard; paper in bin only.
facility_intel.availability: High in SkyTrain (BTS) stations and shopping podiums.

arrival.eSimAdvice: AIS or dtac eSIM at BKK/Suvarnabhumi; buy before leaving airport or use Airalo
arrival.eSimHack: Airalo and AIS/dtac sell eSIM at BKK; buy before leaving baggage to avoid markup.
arrival.airportHack: BKK has fast immigration; use Grab from official pickup, avoid touts
arrival.transitHack: BTS Skytrain and MRT avoid surface traffic; use Chao Phraya boat for riverside areas.

connectivity.note: Free airport WiFi opens after a browser login page. Keep eSIM fallback ready.

immigration.strategy: Use biometric/eGate lanes if eligible; most visitors should follow the manual foreign passport queue signs.

transport.taxiEstimate: Taxi to city center: 350-550 THB (plus tolls).
transport.trainEstimate: Airport Rail Link + BTS: ~45-80 THB total to central zones.

borderStatus.summary_note: Visa rules dynamically verified based on selected passport.
borderStatus.offline_fallback: Showing last verified visa rules. Confirm with embassy if travel is time-sensitive.

arrivalMistakes: Exchanging large amounts at airport counters.
Leaving without SIM or offline map access.
Forgetting toll fees are separate from taxi meter.

systemHealth.offline_message: Live system data unavailable. Showing last verified status.

neighborhoods.name: Silom
neighborhoods.vibe: Business by day, nightlife by night

survival_kit.tipping: Not expected, but rounding up 20-50 THB is appreciated in taxis/cafes
survival_kit.toilets: Carry tissues; many public toilets are 'squat' style and charge 5-10 THB

transit_logic.payment_method: Rabbit Card for BTS; Cash for MRT and Street Food
transit_logic.etiquette: Give up seats for monks; Keep your head lower than elders

scam_alerts: The 'Grand Palace is closed today' lie by tuk-tuk drivers
Unmetered taxis outside major malls (insist on 'Meter, please')
Bird seed/bracelet 'gifts' that you are then forced to pay for
real_time_hacks: Use the 'Chao Phraya Express Boat' to bypass traffic for 15-30 THB
7-Eleven is your best friend for high-speed Wi-Fi and cheap AC breaks
Always carry a sarong/scarf for temple entry (shoulders/knees must be covered)

cities.name: Paris
cities.theme: Culture, cafés, and crowds. Book key sights; walk the arrondissements and skip the obvious traps.

emergency.pharmacy24h: Pharmacies de garde (rotating); dial 3237 or check paris-pharmacies.gouv.fr
emergency.health_note: American Hospital of Paris (Neuilly) is preferred for English speakers.

survival.tipping: Service included (Service Compris). Round up €1-€2 for great service
survival.tapWater: Safe and high quality (Eau de Paris fountains are everywhere)
survival.digitalEntry: ETIAS required for visa-exempt non-EU from 2025; EES (Entry/Exit System) at EU borders in 2026.
survival.touristTax: City tax (taxe de séjour) on overnight stays; often collected at checkout.
currentScams: The 'Friendship Bracelet' men at Sacré-Cœur (keep hands in pockets)
The 'Found Ring' scam (they pretend you dropped a gold ring)
Petition signers who use the distraction to pickpocket

facility_intel.access: Paid (€0.50-€1.50) or free with café purchase.
facility_intel.hygiene: Reliable in luxury shops; 'Sanisettes' vary wildly.
facility_intel.protocol: Flush paper (Standard); automated cleaning in street pods.
facility_intel.availability: Moderate; look for the grey 'Sanisette' street pods.

arrival.eSimAdvice: Orange or Free eSIM; EU roaming applies if you have an EU plan. ETIAS required for non-EU from 2025.
arrival.eSimHack: Orange Prepaid eSIM at CDG/ORY; Free Mobile shops in city. EU SIMs roam here at no extra cost.
arrival.airportHack: CDG: use RER B or official taxis; Gare du Nord has Eurostar eGates. Smart Gate / Parafe at CDG/ORY for eligible passports.
arrival.transitHack: RER B runs to CDG; check for strikes. Bonjour RATP shows real-time Metro/RER.

connectivity.note: Airport WiFi is stable enough for maps and train booking before SIM activation.

immigration.strategy: Eligible passports can use PARAFE eGates. Others should stay in staffed passport control lanes.

transport.taxiEstimate: Official taxi to city center: ~55-65 EUR flat-zone pricing.
transport.trainEstimate: RER B to central Paris: ~11.80 EUR, fastest in normal conditions.

survival_kit.tap_water: Safe and high quality (Eau de Paris fountains are everywhere)
survival_kit.tipping: Service included (Service Compris). Round up €1-€2 for great service
survival_kit.toilets: Use 'Sanisettes' (free self-cleaning street pods) or museum restrooms

transit_logic.payment_method: Navigo Easy card (loaded via phone) or contactless (certain lines)
transit_logic.etiquette: Always start interactions with 'Bonjour'. Failing to do so is seen as a direct insult

scam_alerts: The 'Friendship Bracelet' men at Sacré-Cœur (keep hands in pockets)
The 'Found Ring' scam (they pretend you dropped a gold ring)
Petition signers who use the distraction to pickpocket
real_time_hacks: Download the 'Fontaines' app to find free sparkling water fountains
Dinner starts late (19:30+). Lunch is strictly 12:00-14:00
Avoid the 'Champs-Élysées' for food—expensive and low quality

cities.name: London
cities.theme: The Post-Frictionless Era & The Smart-App Buffer

emergency.pharmacy24h: NHS 111 for advice; Boots at Victoria and some stations; Superdrug 24h limited
emergency.health_note: NHS 111 (dial 111) for urgent medical advice that isn't life-threatening.

survival.tipping: 12.5% service charge often added to restaurant bills. Extra tip not needed
survival.digitalEntry: UK ETA mandatory as of Feb 25, 2026 (£16 fee). Linked to passport.
survival.touristTax: New 5% Visitor Levy on all London overnight stays (approx £10-£15/night).
currentScams: Unlicensed West End rickshaws
South Bank pickpockets

facility_intel.access: Free in museums/pubs; £0.20-£0.50 at major rail stations.
facility_intel.hygiene: High in department stores; functional in Tube stations.
facility_intel.protocol: Flush paper (Standard); RADAR key needed for some accessible units.
facility_intel.availability: High; pubs are the unofficial public network.

arrival.eSimAdvice: UK eSIM from EE, O2, or Three; EU roaming no longer guaranteed post-Brexit. Check your plan.
arrival.eSimHack: Airalo or Saily. O2 is the only carrier with free EU roaming fallback.
arrival.airportHack: Heathrow: Elizabeth Line. Gatwick: Gatwick Express.
arrival.transitHack: Oyster is dead. Use Contactless/Apple Pay only to benefit from automatic daily price capping.

connectivity.note: Use WiFi to preload TfL/Citymapper before exiting the terminal.

immigration.strategy: Use ePassport gates if eligible; otherwise proceed to manual Border Force desks.

transport.taxiEstimate: Taxi to central London: ~65-110 GBP depending on airport and traffic.
transport.trainEstimate: Elizabeth Line/Heathrow Express options: ~13-25 GBP to central areas.

survival_kit.tipping: 12.5% service charge often added to restaurant bills. Extra tip not needed
survival_kit.toilets: Download 'Flush' app. Department stores (Selfridges/Liberty) have best free toilets

transit_logic.payment_method: Strictly Contactless/Apple/Google Pay. Do not buy paper tickets
transit_logic.etiquette: Stand on the RIGHT on escalators. Do not make eye contact on the Tube

scam_alerts: Unlicensed West End rickshaws
South Bank pickpockets
real_time_hacks: Use the 'Hopper Fare': Unlimited bus journeys for £1.75 within one hour
Free views: Book 'Sky Garden' or 'Lookout' 3 weeks in advance for free city vistas
Tesco/Sainsbury's 'Meal Deal' is the cheapest lunch in the city (£3.50-£5.00)

cities.name: Tokyo
cities.theme: Bypassing the Chip Shortage & The High-Cost Shift

emergency.pharmacy24h: Matsumoto Kiyoshi and Sugi in major areas; convenience stores have basics
emergency.health_note: Few operators speak English; use translation app. Some hospitals require upfront payment.

survival.tipping: Not customary; can be seen as rude. No tipping in taxis or restaurants.
survival.tapWater: World-class; safe to drink from taps and many public fountains
survival.digitalEntry: VisitJapanWeb QR mandatory. JESTA pre-clearance required for visa-free entry.
survival.touristTax: Departure tax tripled to ¥3,000 as of July 2026.
currentScams: Shinjuku bar touts
Fake monk donations

fuel.intel: Look for 'Standing Ramen' inside major stations for a $4 high-quality fuel hit in 10 minutes.
fuel.availability: Open 24h options via major konbini chains.

facility_intel.access: Free (Universal); no purchase required for most.
facility_intel.hygiene: Superior; globally recognized as the cleanest facilities.
facility_intel.protocol: High-tech Washlets (bidets); flush paper; sound-masking tech.

arrival.eSimAdvice: Pre-order eSIM (Ubigi, Sakura, Mobal) or pick up at Haneda/Narita. Pocket WiFi still popular.
arrival.eSimHack: Use Ubigi or Nomad for best 5G subway coverage; physical SIMs often out of stock.
arrival.airportHack: Narita: Keisei Skyliner. Haneda: Tokyo Monorail.
arrival.transitHack: Physical Suica/Pasmo cards are discontinued for tourists. Add Mobile Suica to Apple/Google Wallet before landing.

connectivity.note: Use airport WiFi to activate Mobile Suica and rail routing apps immediately.

immigration.strategy: Follow automated immigration flow where available; otherwise use staffed arrival inspection counters.

transport.taxiEstimate: Taxi to central Tokyo: ~7000-9000 JPY from major airports.
transport.trainEstimate: Airport rail options: ~500-3000 JPY depending on line and destination.

survival_kit.tap_water: World-class; safe to drink from taps and many public fountains
survival_kit.power_plug: Type A & B (100V, 50Hz in Tokyo). US plugs work; EU/UK need adapter.
survival_kit.tipping: Not customary; can be seen as rude. No tipping in taxis or restaurants.
survival_kit.toilets: Mix of Western and high-tech washlets. Often free and spotless in stations.

transit_logic.primary_app: Google Maps or Japan Travel by Navitime; Suica/Pasmo in Apple Wallet
transit_logic.payment_method: Suica or Pasmo (IC cards) for trains/buses; cash still common in small shops
transit_logic.etiquette: No phones in priority seats; no talking on trains; queue neatly; no eating while walking

scam_alerts: Shinjuku bar touts
Fake monk donations
real_time_hacks: Convenience stores (7-Eleven, Lawson) have excellent cheap meals and free Wi-Fi
Stand on the left on escalators in Tokyo (opposite of Osaka)
Last trains run around midnight—plan ahead or expect expensive taxis

cities.name: New York
cities.theme: Fast, loud, and 24/7. OMNY and apps beat paper tickets; avoid Times Square traps.

emergency.pharmacy24h: CVS and Duane Reade 24h in Manhattan; check store locator
emergency.health_note: 911 for all emergencies. ER visits are expensive; travel insurance recommended.

survival.tipping: 15-20% in restaurants; $1-2 per drink at bars; tip cab/Uber drivers.
survival.tapWater: Safe to drink (NYC tap is famously good). Refill at parks and stations.
survival.digitalEntry: ESTA for visa-waiver nationals; Global Entry and Mobile Passport for faster CBP at major airports.
survival.touristTax: No federal tourist tax; NYC has no city-level overnight levy as of 2026.
currentScams: Fake 'CD' or 'mixtape' handoffs that you're then charged for
'Free' bracelet or photo with costumed characters in Times Square
Unofficial ticket sellers and 'skip-the-line' hustlers

facility_intel.access: Technically free in parks, but mostly 'customer only'.
facility_intel.hygiene: Often poor in subway; high in hotel lobbies/Starbucks.
facility_intel.availability: Critical low; use hotel lobbies or 'Got2Go' app map.

arrival.eSimAdvice: US eSIM from T-Mobile, Verizon, or Airalo. Most international plans include US.
arrival.eSimHack: Airalo or T-Mobile eSIM before you fly; MTA app works offline for subway map.
arrival.airportHack: JFK: AirTrain to LIRR or subway. Newark: NJ Transit or Uber. LaGuardia: bus to subway. Global Entry / Mobile Passport for faster CBP.
arrival.transitHack: OMNY tap on subway and bus; Citymapper shows real-time MTA and disruptions.

connectivity.note: Open maps and ride apps before leaving customs to avoid curbside delays.

immigration.strategy: Use Global Entry or Mobile Passport Control where eligible; otherwise join standard CBP lanes.

transport.taxiEstimate: Taxi to Manhattan: ~70-95 USD including tolls and fees.
transport.trainEstimate: AirTrain + LIRR/subway: ~13-20 USD depending on route.

survival_kit.tap_water: Safe to drink (NYC tap is famously good). Refill at parks and stations.
survival_kit.power_plug: Type A & B (120V, 60Hz). EU/UK need adapter.
survival_kit.tipping: 15-20% in restaurants; $1-2 per drink at bars; tip cab/Uber drivers.
survival_kit.toilets: Starbucks and hotels; many subway stations have no or pay toilets.

transit_logic.primary_app: Citymapper or Google Maps; MTA website for subway status
transit_logic.payment_method: OMNY (tap) or MetroCard for subway/bus; contactless widely accepted
transit_logic.etiquette: Let people off before boarding; no eye contact; keep bags closed on crowded trains

scam_alerts: Fake 'CD' or 'mixtape' handoffs that you're then charged for
'Free' bracelet or photo with costumed characters in Times Square
Unofficial ticket sellers and 'skip-the-line' hustlers
real_time_hacks: Unlimited 7-day MetroCard pays off after ~12 rides
Free Staten Island Ferry for skyline views; avoid paid boat tours
Happy hour and prix-fixe lunches are the best value

cities.name: Rome
cities.theme: Ancient and chaotic. Book Colosseum and Vatican ahead; drink from nasoni and avoid menu traps.

emergency.pharmacy24h: Farmacie di turno (rotating); check 118 or local listings
emergency.health_note: 112 is the single EU emergency number. Guardia Medica for non-life-threatening.

survival.tipping: Coperto may be on the bill. Round up or 5-10%; no obligation.
survival.tapWater: Safe and excellent; use nasoni (street fountains) to refill for free
survival.digitalEntry: ETIAS for visa-exempt non-EU from 2025; EES at Schengen borders in 2026.
survival.touristTax: City tax (tassa di soggiorno) on overnight stays; often charged at checkout.
currentScams: 'Friendship bracelet' or rosemary forced into your hand then payment demanded
Gladiators outside Colosseum charging for photos
Restaurants with no prices or 'tourist menus' with hidden charges

facility_intel.access: Paid (€1.00) for 'P-Stop' kiosks or café purchase.
facility_intel.hygiene: Moderate; seats often missing by design for sanitation.
facility_intel.protocol: Flush paper; foot-pedal sinks common in older bars.
facility_intel.availability: Scarce; plan around museum visits and lunch stops.

arrival.eSimAdvice: Italian eSIM (TIM, Vodafone, Iliad). ETIAS required for non-EU from 2025. EU roaming if you have EU plan.
arrival.eSimHack: TIM or Iliad eSIM at FCO/CTA; Moovit has real-time ATAC and regional transit.
arrival.airportHack: FCO: Leonardo Express to Termini. Ciampino: bus to Termini. Use eGates (EU/EEA/Schengen) where available.
arrival.transitHack: ATAC app for metro/bus; validate ticket on first use. FreeNow for taxis.

connectivity.note: Use WiFi to confirm train platforms and digital tickets before terminal exit.

immigration.strategy: EU/EEA passports can use eGates where posted; others proceed to staffed immigration lanes.

transport.taxiEstimate: FCO official taxi to central Rome: ~55 EUR fixed fare zone.

survival_kit.tap_water: Safe and excellent; use nasoni (street fountains) to refill for free
survival_kit.power_plug: Type L (230V, 50Hz). Adapter needed for US/UK.
survival_kit.tipping: Coperto may be on the bill. Round up or 5-10%; no obligation.
survival_kit.toilets: Pay toilets common (€0.50-1). Cafés expect a small purchase for WC use.

transit_logic.primary_app: Moovit or ATAC official app; Google Maps for walking
transit_logic.payment_method: Roma Pass or contactless on buses/trams; buy tickets before boarding
transit_logic.etiquette: Validate ticket on first use; dress modestly for churches

scam_alerts: 'Friendship bracelet' or rosemary forced into your hand then payment demanded
Gladiators outside Colosseum charging for photos
Restaurants with no prices or 'tourist menus' with hidden charges
real_time_hacks: Free drinking water from nasoni—bring a bottle
Book Colosseum/Forum online to skip lines and avoid touts
Aperitivo (6-9pm) often includes buffet for the price of a drink

cities.name: Barcelona
cities.theme: Gaudí, beach, and tapas. Book Sagrada Família; watch bags on Metro and La Rambla.

emergency.pharmacy24h: Farmacias de guardia (rotating); 010 or check web
emergency.health_note: 112 is the single EU emergency number. CatSalut for public health.

survival.tipping: Not expected; round up or small change. Service may be included.
survival.tapWater: Safe to drink but often chlorinated; many prefer bottled.
survival.digitalEntry: ETIAS for non-EU from 2025; EES at Schengen borders in 2026.
survival.touristTax: Catalonia tourist tax on overnight stays; varies by accommodation type.
currentScams: Pickpockets on La Rambla and Metro (distraction, bump-and-grab)
'Friendly' strangers offering rosemary or petition then demanding money
Fake 'police' asking to see wallet or documents

facility_intel.access: Free in malls/libraries; small fee at beach units.
facility_intel.hygiene: Reliable in modern Eixample; basic in Gothic Quarter.
facility_intel.protocol: Flush paper (Standard); buttons often on wall, not tank.
facility_intel.availability: Good; city markets (Mercats) are reliable hubs.

arrival.eSimAdvice: Spanish eSIM (Vodafone, Orange, Movistar). ETIAS for non-EU from 2025. EU roaming applies.
arrival.eSimHack: Vodafone or Orange at BCN; TMB app for metro/bus real-time. T-casual at station for 10 journeys.
arrival.airportHack: BCN: Aerobús or R2 Nord to city. eGates for EU/EEA/Schengen. T-casual at station for 10 journeys.
arrival.transitHack: TMB app shows live metro/bus; T-casual is cheaper than single tickets for multiple rides.

connectivity.note: Use airport WiFi to load TMB routing and purchase transport options before departure.

immigration.strategy: Smart border eGates for eligible passports; manual lanes for all others.

transport.taxiEstimate: Taxi to city center: ~35-45 EUR depending on traffic.
transport.trainEstimate: R2 Nord commuter rail: ~4.90 EUR, Aerobus: ~6.75 EUR.

survival_kit.tap_water: Safe to drink but often chlorinated; many prefer bottled.
survival_kit.power_plug: Type F (230V, 50Hz). Adapter needed for US/UK.
survival_kit.tipping: Not expected; round up or small change. Service may be included.
survival_kit.toilets: Pay toilets in some areas; cafés and museums are reliable.

transit_logic.primary_app: TMB (metro) or Citymapper; Google Maps for walking
transit_logic.payment_method: Hola BCN card or T-casual; contactless on buses
transit_logic.etiquette: Dress modestly for Sagrada Família; watch bags on Metro and La Rambla

scam_alerts: Pickpockets on La Rambla and Metro (distraction, bump-and-grab)
'Friendly' strangers offering rosemary or petition then demanding money
Fake 'police' asking to see wallet or documents
real_time_hacks: Book Sagrada Família and Park Güell online; skip long queues
T-casual gives 10 journeys on metro/bus for much less than single tickets
Eat away from La Rambla for better quality and prices

cities.name: Dubai
cities.theme: Luxury, heat, and ambition. Nol card for transit; dress modestly and avoid street tour touts.

emergency.pharmacy24h: Life Pharmacy, Aster; some in malls and near hospitals
emergency.health_note: Private hospitals common; travel insurance recommended. Sharia applies; no PDA in public.

survival.tipping: 10-15% in restaurants; AED 5-10 for valet/delivery. Not always expected in hotels.
survival.tapWater: Desalinated; technically safe but many prefer bottled. Hotels often provide bottles.
survival.digitalEntry: Visa or visa on arrival for many nationals; eGates for eligible passengers at DXB.
survival.touristTax: No federal tourist tax; some hotels add municipality or tourism fees at checkout.
currentScams: Fake luxury goods in souks
Timeshare and property pitches with 'free' desert safari
Overpriced tours and activities sold on the street or beach

facility_intel.access: Free (Universal) in all malls, metros, and souks.
facility_intel.hygiene: Superior; cleaning attendants present 24/7 in malls.
facility_intel.availability: Excellent; Malls act as massive infrastructure hubs.

arrival.eSimAdvice: Etisalat or du eSIM at DXB; pre-order or buy on arrival. Strict Web Filter: Use VPN for WhatsApp/Skype calls.
arrival.eSimHack: Etisalat eSIM at DXB arrivals; RTA Dubai app for Metro/tram/bus and Nol balance.
arrival.airportHack: DXB: Metro Red Line to city; eGates for eligible nationals. Taxi queue is organised; use Careem for app-based.
arrival.transitHack: Buy 'Silver Nol' at DXB Metro Entrance (AED 25). Scan Nol on Entry AND Exit. Careem for taxis; RTA app shows real-time services.

connectivity.note: Connect before leaving arrivals to top up Nol balance and preload transit directions.

immigration.strategy: Use Smart Gates if eligible. Otherwise follow staffed passport control and visa validation desks.

transport.taxiEstimate: Taxi to central zones: ~70-110 AED depending on destination.
transport.trainEstimate: Metro Red Line from DXB: ~6-12 AED for most central stops.

survival_kit.tap_water: Desalinated; technically safe but many prefer bottled. Hotels often provide bottles.
survival_kit.power_plug: Type G (230V, 50Hz). UK-style. Adapter for US/EU.
survival_kit.tipping: 10-15% in restaurants; AED 5-10 for valet/delivery. Not always expected in hotels.
survival_kit.toilets: Western and high standard in malls and hotels; free and clean.

transit_logic.primary_app: Careem or RTA Dubai (Nol card); Google Maps for directions
transit_logic.payment_method: Buy 'Silver Nol' at DXB Metro Entrance (AED 25) for Metro/tram/bus. Scan Nol on Entry AND Exit. Cards widely accepted elsewhere.
transit_logic.etiquette: Women-only carriages on Metro; no eating/drinking on Metro; dress modestly

scam_alerts: Fake luxury goods in souks
Timeshare and property pitches with 'free' desert safari
Overpriced tours and activities sold on the street or beach
real_time_hacks: Buy 'Silver Nol' at DXB Metro Entrance (AED 25) and scan on Entry AND Exit
Friday brunches are a Dubai institution but book in advance
Mall AC is fierce—carry a light layer

cities.name: Seoul
cities.theme: K-pop, tech, and 24/7 energy. T-money and Kakao apps; last subway ~midnight.

emergency.pharmacy24h: Yak (약) pharmacies; some 24h in Hongdae, Gangnam. Tourist hotline 1330.
emergency.health_note: Itaewon and Gangnam have hospitals with English-speaking staff.

survival.tipping: Not expected; can be refused. No tipping in taxis or restaurants.
survival.tapWater: Safe (purified); refill at public stations and in subway.
survival.digitalEntry: K-ETA for visa-waiver nationals; Smart Entry (eGates) at ICN/GMP when eligible.
survival.touristTax: No national tourist or departure tax as of 2026.
currentScams: Overpriced skincare in some tourist areas (compare with Olive Young)
Bar hostess tabs in Hongdae/Itaewon with unclear pricing
Unlicensed taxis at airport charging flat high fares

facility_intel.access: Free (Universal) in subway stations and buildings.
facility_intel.protocol: Check signs: older pipes = paper in bin; newer = flush.
facility_intel.availability: Exceptional; every subway exit is a guaranteed option.

arrival.eSimAdvice: KT or SKT eSIM at ICN/GMP; pre-order (Klook, Trazy) or buy on arrival. Korea has excellent 5G.
arrival.eSimHack: KT or LG U+ eSIM at ICN; KakaoMap and Naver Map have better local detail than Google.
arrival.airportHack: ICN: AREX to Seoul Station or express bus. GMP: subway to city. Use Smart Entry (eGates) if eligible.
arrival.transitHack: T-money for subway and bus; KakaoMap shows real-time subway and bus arrivals.

connectivity.note: Use airport WiFi to activate Kakao/Naver maps and transit cards before exit.

immigration.strategy: Use Smart Entry/eGates when available; otherwise proceed to staffed immigration counters.

transport.trainEstimate: AREX to Seoul Station: ~4450-9500 KRW depending on service type.

survival_kit.tap_water: Safe (purified); refill at public stations and in subway.
survival_kit.power_plug: Type C & F (220V, 60Hz). Adapter for US flat pins.
survival_kit.tipping: Not expected; can be refused. No tipping in taxis or restaurants.
survival_kit.toilets: Western; clean in subway and malls. Often free.

transit_logic.primary_app: Kakao T (taxi), KakaoMap or Naver Map for transit
transit_logic.payment_method: T-money for subway/bus; cards widely accepted; some small places cash only
transit_logic.etiquette: Priority seats for elderly; no eating on subway; stand on right on escalators

scam_alerts: Overpriced skincare in some tourist areas (compare with Olive Young)
Bar hostess tabs in Hongdae/Itaewon with unclear pricing
Unlicensed taxis at airport charging flat high fares
real_time_hacks: T-money card works in convenience stores and some cafés too
Subway has English and is very efficient; avoid rush hour if possible
Olive Young and CU/GS25 for cheap snacks and essentials

cities.name: Mexico City
cities.theme: Altitude, culture, and street food. Uber/diDi over street taxis; bottled water only.

emergency.pharmacy24h: Farmacias del Ahorro, Similares; 24h in many areas
emergency.health_note: 911 is unified. Private hospitals (e.g. ABC) have English staff; travel insurance advised.

survival.tipping: 10-15% in restaurants; round up taxis. Small change for baggers and gas attendants.
survival.tapWater: Don't drink. Use bottled water; avoid ice from street vendors. Brush teeth with bottled.
survival.digitalEntry: FMM tourist permit (often included in airfare); eGates at MEX for eligible nationals.
survival.touristTax: No federal tourist tax; some states or hotels may add local levies.
currentScams: Taxi drivers 'without change' or taking long routes
Fake police asking to see wallet or 'check' money
ATM skimmers—use bank lobbies and cover the keypad

fuel.staple: Tacos de Canasta or Tamales (Morning) / Tacos al Pastor (Night).
fuel.intel: Street stalls near Metro stations are safe, fast, and the city's true energy source.
fuel.availability: Strong morning/night windows near Metro corridors.

facility_intel.access: Paid (5-10 MXN); attendant provides 3-4 paper squares.
facility_intel.hygiene: High in 'Plazas'; very basic in Metro stations.
facility_intel.protocol: Paper in bin strictly; old plumbing cannot handle tissue.

arrival.eSimAdvice: Telcel or Oxxo eSIM; buy at MEX or Oxxo. Data is cheap; US/MX plans often include Mexico.
arrival.eSimHack: Telcel eSIM at MEX or any Oxxo; Uber/DiDi from official pickup zone only.
arrival.airportHack: MEX: Uber/diDi from designated area; avoid unlicensed taxis. Benito Juárez has eGates for some nationals. Altitude 2,240m—take it easy day one.
arrival.transitHack: Metro is cheap but crowded; Uber/DiDi safer for late night. Google Maps works for transit.

connectivity.note: Use airport WiFi to confirm official ride pickup zone before walking outside.

immigration.strategy: Most travelers use manual immigration desks; eGates may appear for select nationalities and lanes.

transport.taxiEstimate: Authorized taxi/ride app to city center: ~300-450 MXN.
transport.trainEstimate: Metro + bus path: ~10-20 MXN with more transfer time.

survival_kit.tap_water: Don't drink. Use bottled water; avoid ice from street vendors. Brush teeth with bottled.
survival_kit.power_plug: Type A & B (127V, 60Hz). US plugs work.
survival_kit.tipping: 10-15% in restaurants; round up taxis. Small change for baggers and gas attendants.
survival_kit.toilets: Carry tissue; many public toilets lack it. Cafés and malls are safest.

transit_logic.primary_app: Uber or DiDi; Google Maps. Metro is cheap but very crowded.
transit_logic.payment_method: Cash dominant for taxis and small vendors; card in malls and restaurants
transit_logic.etiquette: Keep bags in front; avoid displaying phones on Metro and in crowds

scam_alerts: Taxi drivers 'without change' or taking long routes
Fake police asking to see wallet or 'check' money
ATM skimmers—use bank lobbies and cover the keypad
real_time_hacks: Uber is safer and often similar price to street taxis; avoid unlicensed cabs
Altitude is 2,240m—take it easy the first day; stay hydrated
Mercados and street food are great but stick to busy, hygienic-looking stalls
